picture.translation[0].definitions[0].de: shapes, lines etc painted or drawn on a surface, showing what someone or something looks like
picture.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The room had several pictures on the walls.
a book with pictures in it
Draw a picture of your house.
He asked her permission to paint her picture  (=paint a picture of her).
I like that picture of the two horses.
picture.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I asked the waiter if he’d mind taking our picture.
take somebody’s picture/take a picture of somebody
Would you like to see the wedding pictures?
That’s a great picture of you, Dad!
picture.translation[0].definitions[2].de: an image that appears on a television or cinema screen
picture.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: upsetting pictures of the famine in Africa
picture.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a description or idea of what something is like
picture.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: The description in the guidebook showed rather a rosy picture (=one that makes you think that something is better than it really is).
I now have a vivid picture (=very clear picture) in my mind.
The book gives you a good picture of what life was like in Japan in the early 19th century.
The article paints a rather bleak picture of the future of our planet.
Detectives are trying to build up a picture of the kidnapper.
picture.translation[0].definitions[4].de: the general situation in a place, organization etc
picture.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: The worldwide picture for tribal people remains grim.
Checks throughout the region revealed a similar picture everywhere.
We were so caught up with the details, we lost sight of the big picture  (=the situation considered as a whole).
picture.translation[0].definitions[5].de: an image or memory that you have in your mind
picture.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Sarah had a mental picture of Lisbon.
He had a vivid picture in his mind.
picture.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: It was voted the year’s best picture.
picture.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: Would you like to go to the pictures?
picture.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 1: shapes, lines etc painted or drawn on a surface, showing what someone or something looks like
picture.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: She drew a picture of a mushroom on the blackboard.
He’s done a picture of a monster.
Three pictures hung on the wall over his bed.
The picture shows two women leaning down towards a third.
There's a picture of his wife above the fireplace.
picture.translation[0].note_box[1].headi: – Meaning 4: a description or idea of what something is like
picture.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: a clear/good picture
He still didn’t have a clear picture of what had happened.
a vivid picture
Their diaries give us a vivid picture of their lives at the time.
an accurate/true picture
Our aim is to build an accurate picture of the needs of disabled people.
a distorted/misleading picture
The media coverage left many people with a distorted picture.
These figures give a misleading picture of the company’s financial health.
a detailed picture
We now have a detailed picture of the bird’s habits.
a complete/full picture
By asking these questions, I was able to get a more complete picture.
an overall/general picture
The study is intended to provide an overall picture of political activity in the nation.
a bleak/gloomy/grim picture
The report paints a bleak picture of the economy.
a rosy picture
That figure paints a misleadingly rosy picture.
have a picture
I've never been there, but I have a picture of it in my mind.
a picture emerges
No clear picture emerges from the studies.
get a picture
Scientists have been trying to get a better picture of how the drug works.
build up/form a picture
Detectives are still trying to build up a picture of what happened.
give/provide a picture
Her book gives us an interesting picture of ordinary people’s homes at the time.
present a picture
Newspapers tend to present a grim picture of what's going on in the world.
paint a picture
The latest survey paints a grim picture.
picture.translation[0].note_box[2].secti: shapes, lines etc painted or drawn on a surface, especially as a piece of art, and often showing what someone or something looks like
a picture of a horse
He painted the picture in 1890, just before he died.
drawing
a picture drawn with a pencil, pen etc
We had to do a drawing of a sunflower.
sketch
a picture that is drawn quickly
I made a quick sketch of the kind of room we wanted.
painting
a picture made using paint
The painting now hangs in the Museum of Modern Art.
Picasso did several paintings of her.
portrait
a picture of a person
The portrait was painted by Rembrandt.
landscape
a picture of a place, especially in the countryside or the mountains
Constable painted mainly landscapes.
cartoon
a funny drawing in a newspaper or magazine that tells a story or a joke
A cartoon in the New York Times showed the president talking to Osama Bin Laden.
comic strip
a series of pictures drawn inside boxes that tell a story
Charles Schultz was famous for his cartoon strip about Snoopy and Charlie Brown.
caricature
a funny drawing of someone that makes a part of someone’s face or body look bigger, worse etc than it really is, especially in a funny way
He is famous for his caricatures of politicians.
illustration
a picture in a book
The book has over 100 pages of illustrations, most of them in colour.
poster
a large picture printed on paper that you stick to a wall as decoration
old movie posters
There were lots of posters of pop bands on her bedroom wall.
print
a picture that is usually produced on a printing press, and is one of a series of copies of the same picture
a limited edition of lithographic prints by John Lennon
image
a picture – used especially when talking about what the picture is like, or the effect it has on you
He produced some memorable images.
a beautiful image
Some of the images are deeply disturbing.
artwork
pictures or photographs, especially ones that have been produced to be used in a book or magazine
We are still waiting for the artwork to come back from the printers.
picture.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to imagine something by making an image in your mind
picture.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Rob had pictured her as serious, but she wasn’t like that.
I can’t picture him skiing. He’s so clumsy!
Picture what it would be like after a nuclear attack.
picture.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to show someone or something in a photograph, painting, or drawing
picture.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: She is pictured with her mum Christine and sister Kelly.
picture.translation[1].definitions[1].no: Picture is usually passive in this meaning
picture.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to describe something in a particular way
picture.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: She’s been pictured as a difficult, demanding woman.
picture.translation[1].definitions[2].no: Picture is usually passive in this meaning
